work.name: Research Foundation for SUNY
work.summary: Guided by Dr. David Doermann, A2IL lab.

work.name: Veritas Technologies LLC
work.summary: Developed a novel algorithm for predictive execution of resource-intensive tasks that reduced execution time by 56%. Demonstrated a paper at Veritas's annual technical conference, named IDLEBOT. Bestowed Certificate of Merit 2020. Developed Ransom-ware Detection tool modeling file change log in Veritas Filesystem (VxFS). Presented project in Veritas's annual Hackathon, 2021. Lead effort to start ML for Systems group in Org.

work.name: Veritas Technologies LLC
work.summary: Reduced execution time of variants of â€˜ls' command by 20% using directory inode read ahead algorithm.

education.institution: University at Buffalo, The State University of New York
University at Buffalo, The State University of New York

awards.title: Google Research Mentorship Program Scholar
awards.summary: Accepted to a three-month program that matches students with Google mentors and peers to support their pursuit of computer science research pathways.

awards.title: Certificate of Merit - Veritas Illuminate
awards.summary: Presented a paper named 'IDLEBOT - Predictive execution of resource-intensive tasks' in Veritas's annual technical conference.

awards.title: Honorable Mention ACM-ICPC 2015 Regionals
awards.awarder: Association of Computing Machinery and Baylor University
awards.summary: Represented Walchand College of Engineering FIRST time in International Collegiate Programming Contest regionals at Amrita University, Coimbatore. It is sponsored by IBM and conducted by ACM in association with Baylor University.

awards.title: Best project competition
awards.awarder: Department of Information Technology, WCE, Sangli
awards.summary: Ranked 2nd best project in the department for calculating top 10 Twitter hashtags using Apache Spark, Beautiful Soup, and Twitter4j API for real-time processing and sentiment analysis, with results visualized using Javascript D3.

awards.title: First Runner Up Code-junkie MINDSPARK-2K14
awards.summary: An algorithmic coding competition with over 500 students in teams of 2 from different colleges in India. It had 3 rounds: MCQ, short coding challenge, and long coding challenge.

awards.title: DST Inspire Science camp
awards.awarder: Indian Institute of Information Technology, Pune
awards.summary: Selected (Top 1%) to participate in Science camp for a week hosted by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, and Indian Institute of Information Technology, Pune.

publications.name: LineFormer: Rethinking Line Chart Data Extraction as Instance Segmentation
publications.publisher: International Conference on Document Analysis and Recognition
publications.summary: Jay Lal, Mahesh Bhosale, Aditya Mitkari, David Doermann

publications.name: ChartReformer: Natural Language-Driven Chart Image Editing
publications.publisher: International Conference on Document Analysis and Recognition

projects.name: Unpaired Text and mask conditioned histopathology image synthesis with diffusion models
projects.summary: Using unpaired text reports and label masks to control histopathology image generation.

projects.name: Action spotting
projects.summary: Using object specific features and their positional correspondence in a frame for temporally precise action detection.

projects.name: Line-Former
projects.summary: Transformer based instance segmentation for document chart data extraction achieving SOTA results across many benchmark chart datasets. Submitted the paper to ICDAR 2023.

projects.name: ROS
projects.summary: Implemented BUG2 obstacle avoidance, Camera calibration, Monocular VO, A* path planning, Bays filter for state estimation for ClearPath Husky in ROS.

projects.name: Re-identification SoccerNetv3
projects.summary: Soccer player re-identification leveraging two-stream (RESNET + OpenPose sub-network) deep neural network using layer-wise triplet similarity loss. Employed Bilinear pooling to pool features from two streams. Beat SOTA OSNET by 2.1% in MAP and 1.8% in IOU.

projects.name: IDLEBOT
projects.summary: Developed command line tool to recommend optimal time slot for execution of resource-intensive tasks for Veritas products using LSTM, FB-Prophet, and ARIMA. The proposed novel 'Weighted time-slot selection algorithm' to select an optimal slot achieved a 56% reduction in exec. time.
